titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER scheduling Change of Plea Hearing on 10/5/2005 08:30 AM in Courtroom 3 (Omaha) before Chief Judge Joseph F. titleInfo.title: USA v. Alvarez
titleInfo.subTitle: PRELIMINARY ORDER OF FORFEITURE - The United States' Motion for Issuance of Preliminary Order of Forfeiture 18 is hereby sustained. The U.S. Marshal is hereby authorized to seize the following described property: $1,247.00 in United States currency. The Defendant's interest in said property is hereby forfeited to the United States of America for disposition in accordance with the law, subject to the provisions of 21 U.S.C. 853(n)(1). The aforementioned forfeited property is to be held by the Marshal in his secure custodyand control. Upon adjudication of all third-party interests, this Court will enter a Final Order of Forfeiture pursuant to 21 U.S.C. 853(n), in which all interests will be addressed, as to Oscar Alvarez (1). Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 10/6/2005. Certified copy USM (JAE, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: PRELIMINARY ORDER OF FORFEITURE - The United States' Motion for Issuance of Preliminary Order of Forfeiture 18 is hereby sustained. The U.S. Marshal is hereby authorized to seize the following described property: $1,247.00 in United States currency. The Defendant's interest in said property is hereby forfeited to the United States of America for disposition in accordance with the law, subject to the provisions of 21 U.S.C. 853(n)(1). The aforementioned forfeited property is to be held by the Marshal in his secure custodyand control. Upon adjudication of all third-party interests, this Court will enter a Final Order of Forfeiture pursuant to 21 U.S.C. 853(n), in which all interests will be addressed, as to Oscar Alvarez (1). Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 10/6/2005. Certified copy USM (JAE, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Alvarez
titleInfo.subTitle: FINAL ORDER OF FORFEITURE - The Plaintiff's Motion for Final Order of Forfeiture 21 is hereby sustained. All right, title and interest in and to the subject property: $1,247.00 in US currency, held by any person or entity, is hereby forever barred and foreclosed. The subject property, $1,247.00 in United States currency, be, and the same hereby is, forfeited to the United States of America. The US Marshal for the District of Nebraska is directed to dispose of saidproperty in accordance with law as to defendant Oscar Alvarez. Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 12/2/2005. (KBJ)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: FINAL ORDER OF FORFEITURE - The Plaintiff's Motion for Final Order of Forfeiture 21 is hereby sustained. All right, title and interest in and to the subject property: $1,247.00 in US currency, held by any person or entity, is hereby forever barred and foreclosed. The subject property, $1,247.00 in United States currency, be, and the same hereby is, forfeited to the United States of America. The US Marshal for the District of Nebraska is directed to dispose of saidproperty in accordance with law as to defendant Oscar Alvarez. Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 12/2/2005. (KBJ)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Alvarez
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Oscar Alvarez (1) - Defendant pleaded guilty to counts III, IV and V of the Indictment and is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for a term of 60 months on counts III and IV to be served concurrently; supervised release with special conditions for 3 years on count III and 4 years on count IV said terms to run concurrently; $200.00 special assessment. Counts I and II of the Indictment are dismissed on the motion of the United States as to this defendant only, as to defendant Oscar Alvarez. Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 1/12/2006. 4 certified copies USM (JAE, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: JUDGMENT as to Oscar Alvarez (1) - Defendant pleaded guilty to counts III, IV and V of the Indictment and is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for a term of 60 months on counts III and IV to be served concurrently; supervised release with special conditions for 3 years on count III and 4 years on count IV said terms to run concurrently; $200.00 special assessment. Counts I and II of the Indictment are dismissed on the motion of the United States as to this defendant only, as to defendant Oscar Alvarez. Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 1/12/2006. 4 certified copies USM (JAE, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Alvarez
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - A Rule 35 hearing is scheduled before the undersigned on January 30, 2007, at 1:30 p.m., in Courtroom No. 3, Roman L. Hruska U.S. Courthouse, 111 South 18th Plaza, Omaha, Nebraska. At the request of the defendant through his counsel, and with the agreement of the government, the defendant may be absent from the hearing on the Rule 35 motion; The Marshal is directed not to return the defendant to the district; and the defendant is held to have waived his right to be present. Counsel for the defendant, if previously appointed pursuant to the Criminal Justice Act, is reappointed to represent the defendant for purposes of the Rule 35(b) motion as to defendant Oscar Alvarez. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon.(TJS)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER - A Rule 35 hearing is scheduled before the undersigned on January 30, 2007, at 1:30 p.m., in Courtroom No. 3, Roman L. Hruska U.S. Courthouse, 111 South 18th Plaza, Omaha, Nebraska. At the request of the defendant through his counsel, and with the agreement of the government, the defendant may be absent from the hearing on the Rule 35 motion; The Marshal is directed not to return the defendant to the district; and the defendant is held to have waived his right to be present. Counsel for the defendant, if previously appointed pursuant to the Criminal Justice Act, is reappointed to represent the defendant for purposes of the Rule 35(b) motion as to defendant Oscar Alvarez. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon.(TJS)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Alvarez
titleInfo.subTitle: AMENDED JUDGMENT (For Reduction of Sentence) as to Oscar Alvarez - Count I and II of the Indictment are dismissed on the motion of the United States as to this defendant only; Defendant pleaded guilty to counts III, IV and V of the Indictment and is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for a term of 40 months on counts III and IV to be served concurrently followed by a term of 3 years on count III and 4 years on count IV said terms to run concurrently; $200 Special Assessment of which a $100.00 balance remains due and payable. The defendant shall forfeit the defendant's interest in the following property to the United States: $1,247.00 in United States Currency. as to defendant(s) Oscar Alvarez Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon.(PCV, ) (4 cc to USM)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska

The defendant shall forfeit the defendant's interest in the following property to the United States: $1,247.00 in United States Currency. as to defendant(s) Oscar Alvarez Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon.(PCV, ) (4 cc to USM)
